posts.author: Orion

Hi everyone,


I thought I would try to redo my devastating critical cleric (DCC) build. Didn't really like pale master in the end, I was taking it really for devastating critical immunity but perhaps the better choice is to avoid getting hit by these enemies. 

I'll make him double devastating now (scimitar and longbow). Just wanted to see the limits of what is possible here as an all-rounder. 

Anyway what do you think?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Why did you abandon the palemaster cleric? I would like to see it done sometime, don't abandon projects when they have such potential, and by solving the nuances of the tough builds is part of what makes us good builders. 

Secondly, this build is already good, but you know what I am going to say, right?

I want to see this finish on Str 32. Abandon Dev Crit with longbow, it's just a bragging right, you don't need it. Stack those Gr Strengths & start with 16 Wisdom & you will finish with Str 32.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I don't see how the STR could end at 32, but 30 is doable.  Starting WIS at 16 wouldn't help because all of the Great WIS feats are takes as Cleric bonus feats, so none of them can be swapped to Great STR.

I'd drop those 3 Longbow feats in epic for 2 Great STR and Epic Prowess.  That would boost your scimtar AB by 2 and your longbow AB by 1.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yeah, he would need to start with Str 17 (32) to get that but otherwise, I agree with your suggestion for 2 Gr Strengths plus EP.

The increased strength will also boost his Dev Crit DC by 1.

Abandon Dev Crit with longbow, it's just a bragging right, you don't need it.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hmm. While your scimitar Dev Crit DC is 40 - which is fine - the longbow DC is 34 (with Zen Archery), which is poor. I'm just not sure you couldn't make better use of the 3 feats you use achieving it - and all in epic levels. Others who know much more about clerics will be better qualified to give knowledgeable opinions.

Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Can a Cleric of Ehlonna be evil?  If you instead went with Cleric 29 / Fighter 8 / Rogue 3, you would get another d6 Sneak damage, and you wouldn't have to be evil.  It's true that you would have a 20% Experience penalty from level 21 on, but does that matter where you have unlimited experience available?

Your Dev Crit DC is always based on your Strength, no matter what your AB is based on.

posts.content:

posts.content:
Cleric expert here!

But this is really about MAD - and as Stag says, WIS in this build is too low to make a true Zen / Dev Crit Epic build.

I can't remember who wrote it recently, but the jist of the argument for an Epic power build is that you do it properly or leave it out - there's no nice to haves.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks for your responses!

I changed him to a hierarch of Obad-Hai, who can be evil, yes Ehlonna is no longer possible as an assassin

Hurmph I ummed and ahhed about it and I'm still umming and ahhing about it

I guess I envisaged this guy as a nasty melee dev critting warrior 'dressed as a cleric' with the ability to buff self and others with with some no DC spell casting such as heal and harm etc.. as we know clerics are a very strong class!

There's a secondary combat style being longbow which I thought I could combine the crazy AB buffs from cleric with devastating critical to make it workable so the threat roll would have a chance to succeed

I could switch those three feats to knockdown, improved knockdown and armor skin I guess - but I recall someone writing they always regretted taking knockdown as a cleric

Assassin seemed attractive for the death attack duration, which the wiki says is 1 turn / assassin level (if my DnD knowledge is correct, 1 turn = 10 rounds?). Even a 5% chance of that happening (ie an opponent rolling a 1) it seems pretty strong. IF its true.

RE double devastating critical there's a thread entitled 'Grom's Challenge' and I've drawn inspiration from a player called Papa Lenin on WoG, who was challenged by a certain other player that a pure fighter couldn't get to level 40 on World of Greyhawk. He succeeded by going double dev crit. (I understand Valerfor succeeded with a pure fighter without going dev crit but I'm not quite at the heights of that type of skill.) He gets an extra 3AB and 6 damage with the longbows from his feats, but I'm hoping that extended Divine Power / Divine Favor / Bless / Aid / Prayer / Battletide / Owl's Wisdom etc will more than compensate plus the ability to cast GMW on bows and darkfire on arrows (this was coded in WoG)
SpoilerOK, there we go, the dust fell down, and here we got a lone survivor

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
With capped AB bonus and wisdom, you can stretch a naked AB of +30 all the way to +56. Clerics, overpowered as they are, can achieve a lot of that from self buffs, but are better at buffing melee weapons than ranged ones. If I recall correctly, WoG let several of the melee only spells work on ranged weapons as well.
Unless the environment is really harsh you should be able to do ranged damage against mobs, at least. It is always good to have a ranged weapon available, and zen is nice to have for a strength based cleric, if you can afford the feat.
If ranged dev crit is worth it with this low AB is questionable at best. Of course one can say that it depends on what you are up against and how you want to play. But with a cleric, powerful as they are, I would see it more as a gimmick than a serious combat style.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: I could switch those three feats to knockdown, improved knockdown and armor skin I guess - but I recall someone writing they always regretted taking knockdown as a cleric
That makes very little sense if any to be honest.

I guess, the only one that could say that & be true would be a spell-sword with Bigby's 6 & 7, but even then the feat can be used unlimited times, unlike the spell.

There is nothing to regret when doing alpha-strikes with 65/65/60/55/65 AB, while buffed & never letting your enemies get up.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks again for the feedback.

I'm guilty of trying to fit too much into the build (lol a devastating critical melee / devastating critical ranged / spell caster hybrid)

The ranged AB of 30 with Zen Archery, with all the cleric buffs is borderline for sure, to invest 3 feats to get devastating critical longbow... hmmm well I have 5 responders saying use the feats elsewhere

And Valerfor is correct it is lovely to engage in 1v1 combat with a combat build and keep an opponent on the ground, my two handed weaponmaster knows that for sure




Anyway I have redone the build, dropped all the archery feats, included improved knockdown and increased the Str to 32 and AB to 40 (the magical target for spellswords!) whilst preserving the infamous BAB 25 to take advantage of an additional full BAB attack from Divine Power

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
There is no doubt that both the Pestilent and the Exalted are powerful builds. 
I understand why you do it, build technically,  but I am not comfortable with the late build-up of wisdom. 
Pestilent could have lvl 7 spells at character level 14, lvl 8 spells at 16 and lvl 9 spells at 18, but doesn't get them before level 25, 35 and 39.
For Exalted it is level 26, 33 and 36 instead of level 15, 17 and 19.
That is a lot of gameplay without spells such as Greater restoration, Resurrection, Mass heal, Implosion and SoV.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote: There is no doubt that both the Pestilent and the Exalted are powerful builds. 
I understand why you do it, build technically,  but I am not comfortable with the late build-up of wisdom. 
Pestilent could have lvl 7 spells at character level 14, lvl 8 spells at 16 and lvl 9 spells at 18, but doesn't get them before level 25, 35 and 39.
For Exalted it is level 26, 33 and 36 instead of level 15, 17 and 19.
That is a lot of gameplay without spells such as Greater restoration, Resurrection, Mass heal, Implosion and SoV.
I suppose it's a question of priorities, because in both instances this would entail dropping Dev Crit back to the mid 30s (level 34 for Pestilent and I've forgotten what it is for Exalted). As with so many things, I suspect environment to be a factor here - if you're going to spend much of your time at level 40, then to a large extent the late blooming matters less; but, certainly for most modules, where you spend most the time actually reaching 40, that earlier playability will be more important. And, of course, in a non-Dev Crit environment all bets are off anyway!

Cheers

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Good point Stag. 
But even so, if I should play these builds, I think waiting 5 levels for dev crit and ending at str 30 instead of 32 is better than waiting 15 - 20 levels for the high level spells. But in a build made for level 40 I agree with taking wisdom late for better end game power.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Mick Stag and Valerfor for the comments!

That feedback is very valuable! 

It takes time and effort to play through and create a character so it's always worth trying one's best to optimise as much as possible before playing through them.

Valerfor you are spot on - I forgot to include extend spell when making the build so I have included this now and unfortunately delayed knockdown till later in the build. I'll sort out the spellcraft skill points a bit later, I think I have gone too heavy on the detection skill points. Bastard swords have a certain style for sure and I have certainly picked up some quite nice Bastard Swords in WoG and Aielund. I wish the exotic ranged weaponry was better

And thanks for the comments on the pictures! Honestly I only start looking for pictures for builds now when I start to feel a little happier about them

Regarding the BAB I have kept it at 25 to make use of the divine power extra attack at full BAB which Maximillian Kane was a very strong advocate for. I have tested it in one of the character creation modules - PGCC - and the extra attack is still at full BAB (so it hasn't been patched out, and functions similar to an extra attack from Haste). I recall if the attack schedule included two extra attacks from divine power and haste, then the progression would look like 39 / 34 / 29 / 39 / 34. I know some cleric players I have read don't really bother with it, but from the power gamer perspective maybe it is stronger? 

Regarding the lack of level 7 to 9 spells early on I have been thinking about that when writing the builds and I am glad you have pointed that out it certainly reduces enjoyability a little knowing those spells could be accessed if the wisdom was higher at that stage of the game

I can drop strength by 2, drop the cleric levels a little and delay devastating critical a little to accommodate the player being able to access level appropriate spells as soon they are potentially available whilst retaining 'undispellability'.

I think it leads to a more enjoyable experience. Both builds will get armor skin.

The Pestilent Heirarch is potentially even stronger, being able to include weapon specialisation and epic weapon specialisation.

As far as I know Cleric / Fighter / Assassin is a fairly unique combination, and havent found anything to compare the build with.

Cleric / CoT / Rogue has been done before, here's a few I can find. 
Battle Priest of Torm cleric 24 / champion of Torm 14 / rogue 2 (human?) by Kurgan13

- Dex 30, Epic Dodge

- Str 26, BAB 26, final AB 38, dev crit at level 38,

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yeah, man, don't be afraid to drop 1AB in cleric builds if that means better playability overall.
In the grand scheme of things, hitting with 66AB vs 65AB, it doesn't really matter.
What matter most, is the build to have all the feats it needs & to play as smoothly as possible.

Now, for the 25BAB thing, it really is fine either way...
Having a constant fourth attack & +1/2AB vs having 3 more AB for 1 attack when you're fully buffed, we're really splitting hairs here.
My method was much more intuitive than that, I simply calculated how many feats would I need for my cleric to have everything he wants pre-epic & went with as many CoT levels as needed.
You instead, went for 25BAB & dropped KD in order to achieve that, it's fine either way, the builds aren't made in stone, they meant to be organic & adaptable to the environment.

Overall, from the two builds, I like them both but I have something for the Hierarch of Pestilence.
Maybe it was just the artwork, or maybe I liked the use of assassin there, or that he has all feats that he needs, I can't pin-point it really.
Would I change something from it?
I think I would go for a Cleric 26/ Fighter 12/ Assassin 2, split. I like the more caster levels & you'll have the chance to even that wisdom.

About playing evil, it can be fun you know. No chaotic evil non-sense, but driven evil with goals.
If you have someone to role-play with as part of the hack & slash is even better, maybe build a name for yourself in the server & give missions to other underlings, maybe create a cult even.
The Cult of Pestilence, sounds about right, haha.

Anyway, have fun!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If a Cleric gets his 4th attack from 26 BAB, that attack will have -15 AB from the full AB, but if he instead gets his 4th attack from Divine Power, it will be at the full AB.  Even considering the 1 or 2 higher AB from the higher BAB, the difference is pretty big.
